001package imagingbook.common.math.eispack;
002
003public abstract class QZHES {
004        
005        // EISPACK Routines, see http://www.netlib.org/eispack/
006        
007        /**
008         * <p>
009         * This subroutine is the first step of the qz algorithm for solving generalized
010         * matrix eigenvalue problems, SIAM J. Numer. Anal. 10, 241-256 (1973) by Moler
011         * and Stewart. This description has been adapted from the original version
012         * (dated August 1983).
013         * </p>
014         * <p>
015         * This subroutine accepts a pair of real general matrices and reduces one of
016         * them to upper Hessenberg form and the other to upper triangular form using
017         * orthogonal transformations. It is usually followed by qzit, qzval and,
018         * possibly, qzvec.
019         * </p>
020         * <p>
021         * On output:
022         * </p>
023         * <ul>
024         * <li><strong>a</strong> has been reduced to upper hessenberg form. The
025         * elements below the first subdiagonal have been set to zero.</li>
026         * 
027         * <li><strong>b</strong> has been reduced to upper triangular form. The
028         * elements below the main diagonal have been set to zero.</li>
029         * 
030         * <li><strong>z</strong> contains the product of the right hand transformations
031         * if matz has been set to true. Otherwise, <strong>z</strong> is not
032         * referenced.</li>
033         * </ul>
034         * 
035         * 
036         * @param a    contains a real general matrix.
037         * @param b    contains a real general matrix.
038         * @param matz should be set to true if the right hand transformations are to be
039         *             accumulated for later use in computing eigenvectors, and to false
040         *             otherwise.
041         * @param z    on output, contains the product of the right hand transformations if matz
042         *             has been set to true. Otherwise, z is not referenced.
043         */
044        public static void qzhes(double[][] a, double[][] b, boolean matz, double[][] z) {
045                
046                final int n = a.length;
047                
048                int i, j, k, l, nm1, nm2;
049                double r, s, t;
050                int l1;
051                double u1, u2, v1, v2;
052                int lb, nk1;
053                double rho;
054        
055                // initialize z (with identity matrix)
056                if (matz) {
057                        for (j = 0; j < n; j++) {
058                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
059                                        z[i][j] = 0.0;
060                                }       //      L2
061                                z[j][j] = 1.0;
062                        }       // L3
063                }
064        
065                // L10: reduce b to upper triangular form
066                if (n <= 1) {
067                        return;
068                }
069                
070                nm1 = n - 1;    // TODO: check!!
071                
072                for (l = 0; l < nm1; l++) {
073                        l1 = l + 1;
074                        s = 0.0;
075        
076                        for (i = l1; i < n; i++) {
077                                s = s + Math.abs(b[i][l]);
078                        }       // L20
079        
080                        if (s != 0.0) {         
081                                s = s + Math.abs(b[l][l]);
082                                r = 0.0;
083                                for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
084                                        b[i][l] = b[i][l] / s;
085                                        r = r + b[i][l] * b[i][l];
086                                }       // L25
087                
088                                r = Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(r), b[l][l]);
089                                b[l][l] = b[l][l] + r;
090                                rho = r * b[l][l];
091                
092                                for (j = l1; j < n; j++) {
093                                        t = 0.0;        // dot product
094                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
095                                                t = t + b[i][l] * b[i][j];
096                                        }       //L30
097                                        t = -t / rho;
098                                        
099                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
100                                                b[i][j] = b[i][j] + t * b[i][l];
101                                        }       // L40
102                                        
103                                }       // L50
104                
105                                for (j = 0; j < n; j++) {
106                                        t = 0.0;        // dot product
107                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
108                                                t = t + b[i][l] * a[i][j];
109                                        }       // L60
110                                        
111                                        t = -t / rho;
112                                        
113                                        for (i = l; i < n; i++) {
114                                                a[i][j] = a[i][j] + t * b[i][l];
115                                        }       // L70
116                                        
117                                }       // L80
118                
119                                b[l][l] = -s * r;
120                                for (i = l1; i < n; i++) {
121                                        b[i][l] = 0.0;
122                                }       // L90
123                        
124                        }       // end if               
125                }       // L100
126        
127                // reduce a to upper Hessenberg form, while keeping b triangular
128                if (n == 2) {
129                        return;
130                }
131                nm2 = n - 2;
132                
133                for (k = 0; k < nm2; k++) {
134                        nk1 = nm1 - k - 1; // = n - 2 - k;
135        
136                        // for l=n-1 step -1 until k+1 do
137                        for (lb = 0; lb < nk1; lb++) {
138                                l = n - lb - 2;                                 // TODO: check!!
139                                l1 = l + 1;
140        
141                                // zero a(l+1,k)
142                                s = Math.abs(a[l][k]) + Math.abs(a[l1][k]);
143                                if (s == 0.0) {
144                                        continue;       // goto 150
145                                }
146                                u1 = a[l][k] / s;
147                                u2 = a[l1][k] / s;
148                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1); 
149                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
150                                v2 = -u2 / r;
151                                u2 = v2 / v1;
152        
153                                for (j = k; j < n; j++) {
154                                        t = a[l][j] + u2 * a[l1][j];
155                                        a[l][j] = a[l][j] + t * v1;
156                                        a[l1][j] = a[l1][j] + t * v2;
157                                }       // L110
158        
159                                a[l1][k] = 0.0;
160        
161                                for (j = l; j < n; j++) {
162                                        t = b[l][j] + u2 * b[l1][j];
163                                        b[l][j] = b[l][j] + t * v1;
164                                        b[l1][j] = b[l1][j] + t * v2;
165                                }       // L120
166        
167                                // zero b(l+1,l)
168                                s = Math.abs(b[l1][l1]) + Math.abs(b[l1][l]);
169                                if (s == 0.0) {
170                                        continue;       // go to 150
171                                }
172                                u1 = b[l1][l1] / s;
173                                u2 = b[l1][l] / s;
174                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
175                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
176                                v2 = -u2 / r;
177                                u2 = v2 / v1;
178        
179                                for (i = 0; i <= l1; i++) {
180                                        t = b[i][l1] + u2 * b[i][l];
181                                        b[i][l1] = b[i][l1] + t * v1;
182                                        b[i][l] = b[i][l] + t * v2;
183                                }       // L130
184        
185                                b[l1][l] = 0.0;
186        
187                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
188                                        t = a[i][l1] + u2 * a[i][l];
189                                        a[i][l1] = a[i][l1] + t * v1;
190                                        a[i][l] = a[i][l] + t * v2;
191                                }       // L140
192        
193                                if (matz) {
194                                        for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
195                                                t = z[i][l1] + u2 * z[i][l];
196                                                z[i][l1] = z[i][l1] + t * v1;
197                                                z[i][l] = z[i][l] + t * v2;
198                                        }       // L145
199                                }
200                        }       // L150
201                }       // L160
202        
203        } // end of qzhes
204
205}
